Look at the heritrix_out.log in $HERITRIX_HOME for some clue.
I suspect yo=
ur signal isn't killing all the processes properly. I use kill -9 and it gu=
arantees a sure shot heritrix termination. 
Did you netstat for the port us=
ed by heritrix? I am quite sure, the default port would show up as occupied=
. Kill that process and you should be good to restart the engine.

-Pranay
=

--- On Sun, 1/17/10, t.schoellhorn <t.schoellhorn@...> wrote:

From:=
 t.schoellhorn <t.schoellhorn@...>
Subject: [archive-crawler] Restart=
ing Heritrix 3.0.0 keeps failing
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Date: =
Sunday, January 17, 2010, 4:21 AM







=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
=
      Hi,



we are using Heritrix 3.0.0 to crawl snaphshots of about 500 W=
eb-Sites. Now I had to restart the Heritrix Engine. As I don't know the rec=
ommended way to stop the engine I "killed" it via its process number (with =
signal 15).



The problem now is: I cannot restart the engine. When starti=
ng the enging with "bin/heritrix -a admin:admin" the progress dots appear e=
nlessly.



Any ideas what I can do to start the engine again?



What is t=
he recommended way to shut down the Crawler?



Cheers,

Tino





    
   =

      <p>Hi,<br>
<br>=

we are using Heritrix 3.0.0 to crawl snaphshots of about 500 Web-Sites. No=
w I had to restart the Heritrix Engine. As I don't know the recommended way=
 to stop the engine I "killed" it via its process number (with signal 15).<=
br>
<br>
The problem now is: I cannot restart the engine. When starting the=
 enging with "bin/heritrix -a admin:admin" the progress dots appear enlessl=
y.<br>
<br>
Any ideas what I can do to start the engine again?<br>
<br>
Wha=
t is the recommended way to shut down the Crawler?<br>
<br>
Cheers,<br>
Tin=
o<br>
